events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision involving their car on the morning of April 29th, requesting to open a claim for damages sustained in the accident.
The claim was categorised as an Auto Accident based on the description including keywords such as vehicle and collision.
An insurance agent specialized in auto claims was assigned to manage the case and contact the customer for next steps.
The claim acknowledgement was sent to the policyholder including details on the documentation required to proceed with the investigation.
Customer was asked to submit accident reports, photos of the vehicle damage, and a copy of the police report to validate the claim.
Relevant documents including photos and police report were submitted by the customer within the expected timeframe, facilitating further processing.
Investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and contacted repair shops to estimate the extent of vehicle damage.
Investigators completed their assessment confirming the validity of the claim and establishing the approximate repair costs for the damaged vehicle.
A settlement amount based on damage estimates was proposed to the customer for their approval and consideration.
Customer acknowledged and accepted the proposed settlement, expressing satisfaction with the timely communication and resolution.
Based on acceptance of the settlement offer, the claim was formally approved and prepared for payment issuance.
Insurance payment covering the repair costs was successfully transferred to the customer's account as per agreement.
The claim was officially closed following the successful payment and confirmation from the customer that repairs were underway.
The case files and all associated documentation were securely archived in the records system for future reference if necessary.
